meanings.definition: The act of steering a vehicle in a way that causes it to turn less sharply than intended.
meanings.sent1: The understeering of the car made it difficult to navigate sharp corners.
meanings.sent2: The driver had to adjust for understeering while making a turn on the slippery road.
meanings.sent3: The understeering of the shopping cart in the supermarket aisle led to a comical situation.
meanings.sent4: Her understeering in the debate caused her to miss the main point of the argument.
meanings.sent5: The understeering of the boat in the strong current was a lesson in control and precision.

meanings.definition: The tendency of a vehicle to turn less sharply than the driver intends.
meanings.sent1: The understeering of the truck on the icy road was a safety concern.
meanings.sent2: Drivers need to be aware of understeering when driving in challenging conditions.
meanings.sent3: The understeering of the remote-controlled car during the race added an element of unpredictability.
meanings.sent4: His understeering in the negotiation led to a compromise that was not in his favor.
meanings.sent5: The understeering of the bicycle on the steep slope required skillful handling to avoid accidents.
